The ponds, in particular, can be a rather fitting place for reflection as well as crying sessions at two in the morning in the middle of an existential crisis. The latter of which, I have more experience in. While watching the turtles and ducks and insects live out their lives, each with some contribution or role, I couldn’t help but wonder about my own sense of purpose as I struggled to navigate this mystery called life. So, I walked past the pond, and past the park and little houses that scream of suburbia, until I reached a main street. It was then that sun shined its brilliant rays atop the palm trees, painting the sky along the way, and as I looked up at the sunrise, I realized I was walking north. Sure enough, they were there, as they had always been. The sturdy overbearing mountains grazed the hazy blue and yellow sky more than any building in the horizon, and as if speaking without words, stirred in me my sense of perseverance.
You might pass it up on first glance - after all, it is a residential area behind a shopping strip, not a place one would assume there are places to live. At least, not places most people would want to live. But if you go behind the old, abandoned Whole Foods and walk back behind the hotels which are only occupied annually aside from a few stints in the summertime for family reunions, you'll find an entire bustling community. Within these communities, on these streets, are a handful of apartment complex - situated next to each other carefully like Russian nesting dolls that have been scrupulously, carefully taken apart and set beside each other in a line down the road, piecemeal. The first apartments you come upon are ones which have been on the news for some fairly unsavory dealings, so we won't focus on those too much - appearances, after all, can be deceiving. But the apartments beside that complex, and the two complexes beside that one, are a whole other world that almost no one living in this area knows about. Across from those complexes is a community college's satellite campus - a quiet, sleepy set of buildings standing sentinel beside the road, where students putter in with coffee in hand, yawning at 7 in the morning to begin their sleepy days. The iron gates creak open to admit them one by one, while commuters shake their fists out the window and groan at them for holding up traffic on days attendance is higher. The road t-bones into another residential road, with a park on one side and a rehabilitation center for people who have broken bones in unfortunate circumstances. The treatment center boasts cheerful porch furniture, and a lazily undulating ceiling fan which churns the warm, thick summertime air back and forth. Children run back and forth in the grass at the park across the street, cartwheeling and pinwheeling across the prickly green stalks while bees lazily turn in the flower patches by the road. Old retired folks walk their dogs on the walking path, scowling at the teenagers on their skateboards and nodding demurely at the teenage girls clustered by the playground equipment, gossiping about boys and the latest YouTube sensations. There is a sushi place in a strip mall beside the park that has inexpensive food but never seems too busy - a swimming supply store right beside that, and a nail salon nestled in between. You could fill your pool for the season while getting a manicure and eating hibachi chicken, all at once - the beauty of a strip mall. There is a frozen yogurt place there too, one of the DIY kind, and you often see the teens in the park clutching cold, sweating cups of frozen yogurt covered in toppings while they do stunts on their skateboards and vape because they believe it to be the coolest. The neighborhood in question is a slice of Americana - a piece of history in the sleepy south where hardly anything changes, not even time.
My neighborhood is interesting. Most of the houses are single family, but there are a few homes that have been split into two, while still being attached, if that makes much sense. My home has a small yard in front of it and a small driveway to the left of the house. It, like most of the others, reminds you of a time not so long ago where living in the suburbs was the American dream. This dream at once seemed to embrace the people of this country, but now its pulling away. But my neighborhood and many more still remain, still call out to us and those who visit that the dream is still alive, and we are still holding onto it as best we can. The people don't feel as optomistic as they used to, the upkeep of the little yards are not what they used to be, but there is still a car or two in every driveway, still the youth play as if the world around them was the whole of their existence. The public school that has been here for almost 90 years still stands, still seems conjure a future in today's youth, while stirring up nostalgia in the older residents. The churches are few and far between, mostly empty, but the basketball courts are still full. All of the homes look different, but feel the same. There is a large supermarket called super "A" that has been owned by a large Yemni family, who are quite possible the only Arab family in the neighborhood. The vast majority of the residents are African American. The streets are wide and the kids usually play footbal, only stopping to allow the cars to pass. Most of the people in my neighborhood have been here for generations and most can tell stories of a past where everyone knew everyone. There was a karate school, but when hollywood stopped making karate kid movies, the kids stopped wanting to be the karate kid, so its now a pharmacy, because drugs make everything better, or so I've heard. There is also a small movie theatre that plays old movies at a discounted price, spared from the crowds by the youth's disdane for its lack of just release titles, but favored by the elders, who think it is a small price to pay for a night out, without the kids of course. There is a single expressway that passes through my town. Though the exit and entrance are in the town next to ours. There was once a petition to get and exit for our town. The youth supported it, while the elders refused. It seems that having the expressway in our town would ruin it, so said the elders who eventually persuaded the city council to deny the request. They are building a new highschool, and we are trying to decide on a mascott for our town. I think a cyborg with a country accent and a log cabin would be then best representation of my town.
Since I live in a large city, my neighborhood is extremely diverse. Residential areas are dispersed, seemingly randomly, between commercial areas, where a variety of businesses are run. Some of these businesses are made up of offices, while others are various stores, restaurants, and places of entertainment. There is no shortage of new restaurants to eat at, or stores to shop in. While some stores are large, well-known, brands that are owned by large corporations, small boutiques are also increasingly popular. They are not only located in various malls, but they also line the streets, which are often in walking distance of neighborhoods that would otherwise be quiet and serene, if not surrounded by so many points of interest. There are also a couple of nearby parks, and I have noticed that people frequent these parks with their young children. Speaking of the people, thereâ€™s actually quite a bit of diversity within my neighborhood. In one small location, we have a prominent LGBTQ+ community, an Orthodox Jewish community, and a collection of refugees and immigrants from the former Soviet Union. Spanning a little further outside of my neighborhood, there are many more individuals of various races and origins, although they are sometimes broken up into their own little communities within the city. We have locations known as Korea town, China town, Little Armenia, and many more, which are only a few miles away. However, only a few miles can prove to be a very lengthy drive. Driving a distance of only 10 miles can sometimes span two hours, due to traffic, especially during rush hour. Hardly anyone in my city walks anywhere, though. While certain locations of interest are inevitably close-by, the city is huge, and people do not generally prefer to commute on foot. As a result, we also have some of the worst traffic in the world, and it can be difficult to find parking spots just about anywhere. Ironically enough, there has been a great deal of construction in recent years, as large apartment buildings are being added to the city. It is seems to be a popular destination, but many residents are disappointed by the prospect of even more people moving in, and even more vehicles on the roads. There are many different types of houses in my city, however. Not everyone lives, or wishes to live, in a large apartment building. Residential areas are made up of houses, of various sizes, and smaller apartment buildings and condominiums. Some properties contain single-family homes, while others contain duplexes. This is true even within my immediately neighborhood, so there is also no lack of diversity in regards to housing options. Similarly, the neighborhood is made up of people of varying ages, and to be perfectly honest, I am not familiar with the majority of my neighbors. It is not really a tight-knit community these days, although I have many memories from my childhood of playing outside with my next-door neighbor, and a few other friends from the neighborhood, who were all close to my age.
“Where is everything?” she asked as we drove past the corn fields which filled the horizon. “This is it!” I said, knowing she’d be in shock of the sparseness of the open landscape. She was from a town in which the grocery store was a 5 minute walk from her house--she’d never seen this much open space in her life. Taken back by the ubiquity of corn fields, I shared with her what it was like to grow up in rural Ohio, and in that moment, she finally knew who I was and where I came from. Driving down a two-lane country road, you will reach a quarry which is filled with water. Just past it is the small development I live in. The houses are mostly composed of brick and stucco. All the houses have at least a half an acre of land to themselves which everyone takes pride in maintaining. During springtime, annually planted flowers are abundant along with the midwestern trees that change with every season. The driveways are all filled with the highest end Mercedes Benz luxury cars that glisten in the midday sun after a good, old-fashioned car wash. Continuing along the road toward my grey stucco home, my Korean neighbor is always outside with a friendly face. He tends to spend the entire day mowing his lawn and can be heard singing over his mower’s hum. Everyone in the neighborhood gets a laugh out of him, but he is always genuine and an amazing person with a unique history. He has grown older and has lost some of his wit as he aged. In his past he was a doctor and usually blends in with the grass and his John Deer Zero Turn mower. Finally, you will reach my home. In the side yard, geese are abundant and are chased by our Terrier. Out back, there is a small stream that feeds into the quarry. Here, you can hear bullfrogs, the stream, and the occasional “moo” from the nearby farms. Across the handmade wooden bridge is an untouched oasis filled with naturally growing trees, herbs, and wildflowers. Here was where I spent most of my childhood. From building tree forts to ‘hunting’ animals (which mostly consisted of chasing them), there was always something to do and usually a neighborhood child available for friendship. The winters in my small town can be painfully brutal, yet there is nothing more beautiful. The yard transforms from a sea of green into an empty wilderness. The trees that once housed vibrant pink, purple, and orange flowers turn into barren skeletons of bark. When blessed with the occasional snowfall, a winter wonderland appears overnight. The backyard is lined with snow angels made by my little sister, and snowmen. My sister and I fought frequently as kids, and during the winter, snowballs were our weapon of choice. We’d build massive igloo-like forts to house our weapons, usually with branches, like an arsenal. In our own little wonderland was where we played pretend during a time where nothing else mattered. We were just young kids without a care in the world.
transformed_texts: I live in a big city. My neighborhood is very different from others. Small houses are near big buildings. Some buildings are offices, others are stores, restaurants, and places to have fun. There are many new places to eat and shop. Some big companies own some of the stores. But many small stores are popular too. They are in big shopping centers or on streets that people can walk on. My neighborhood is close to parks. I see many people with children in these parks. My neighborhood is also very different because there are many kinds of people. We have a group of people who support the LGBTQ+ community, a Jewish community, and people from the former Soviet Union. There are many more people from different countries and races in other parts of the city. They often live in their own areas. For example, we have an area called Korea town, China town, and Little Armenia. But it can take a long time to get to these places because of traffic. Many people in my city do not walk. The city is very big, and it is hard to walk far. We have a lot of traffic problems. Sometimes it takes a long time to find a parking space. Recently, many new buildings have been built. But some people do not want more people to move in. They do not want more cars on the road. There are many kinds of houses in my city. Not everyone lives in big buildings. We have houses, small apartment buildings, and condominiums. Some houses are for one family, and some have two families. My neighborhood is the same. There are many kinds of houses and people of different ages. I do not know most of my neighbors. But when I was a child, I played with my next-door neighbor and some other friends.

My neighborhood is interesting. There are many houses here. Most are single-family homes, but some are split into two, connected houses. My home has a small yard in front and a small driveway to the side. It is like other homes here. They remind us of the past when living in the suburbs was a popular dream in America. But now, fewer people are happy about it. The yards are not as clean as they used to be. There are still cars in most driveways. Children play outside as if nothing is wrong. Our public school, which has been here for almost 90 years, still works. It makes young people think of the future. It also makes older people happy when they remember the past. There are not many churches here, but the basketball courts are always full. All the homes look different, but feel the same. There is a big supermarket called Super A. It belongs to an Arab family who have been here a long time. Most of the people here are African American. The streets are wide, and children play football most of the time. Many people have lived here for years and know each other. They can tell stories about the past when everyone knew each other. There used to be a karate school, but it closed because no one wanted to learn karate anymore. Now it is a pharmacy where people buy medicine. There is also a small movie theater that shows old movies at a low price. Children do not like it, but older people enjoy it. They think it is worth the cost for a night out. We have a highway that goes through our town. It starts and ends in the town next to ours. Some people wanted to fix it so it starts and ends here. But older people did not want the highway in our town. They said it would hurt our town. So, the city said no. We are building a new high school and choosing a symbol for our town. I think a robot with a country accent and a log cabin would be a good symbol for our town.

You might not see it at first. The area behind a shopping strip is not what you expect. But if you walk behind the old, empty Whole Foods and go past the hotels, you will see a busy community. These hotels are only used by families for summer vacations.

There are some apartment buildings there. They are like Russian dolls that have been taken apart and put side by side. Some of the apartments have been in the news for bad reasons. We will not talk about them. But the other buildings are a different story. Almost no one in this area knows about them.

Across from the apartments is a college campus. It is quiet and sleepy. Students go there in the morning to learn. The gates open slowly, and people driving by get angry because it makes traffic. The road meets another street with a park and a place that helps people who break their bones. The park is nice, with flowers and a fan that moves the warm air. Children play in the park, and old people walk their dogs. They see teenagers on skateboards and girls talking about boys and YouTube stars.

There is a place to buy sushi nearby. It is not very busy. There is also a store to buy pool supplies and a place to get a manicure. You can fill your pool and get a manicure at the same time. There is also a place to buy frozen yogurt. Teenagers like to eat it while doing tricks on their skateboards.

This neighborhood is a special place. It is a part of American history in a quiet place where not much changes.

She asked, "Where is everything?" as we drove past big fields of corn. They went as far as the eye could see. I said, "This is it!" She was from a city. She had never seen so much open space in her life. She came from a place where a grocery store was just a five-minute walk from her home.

I told her what it was like to grow up in a small town in Ohio. I explained that I lived far from the city. She listened. Then she understood where I was from. 

As we drove on a two-lane road, we came to a big hole in the ground filled with water. Just past that was the small place where I live. The houses are made of brick and stucco. They are all nice. Every house has a big yard. People take good care of their yards.

In the spring, flowers bloom. The trees change with the seasons. The driveways are filled with nice cars. They shine in the sun after they are washed. My neighbor is a friendly man. He is from Korea. He always mows his lawn. He sings while he works. People like to laugh at him, but he is a kind and interesting man. He used to be a doctor.

As we continued down the road, we came to my house. There are many geese in the yard. They run away from our dog. In back, there is a small stream. The stream feeds the big hole in the ground. You can hear bullfrogs, the stream, and the sound of cows from the nearby farms. Across a small bridge is a special place. It is full of trees, herbs, and wildflowers that grew by themselves. This is where I spent most of my childhood. I built forts in the trees. I also liked to chase animals. There were always friends to play with.

In the winter, the weather can be very cold. But it is also beautiful. The trees are bare. The flowers are gone. The yard is empty. When it snows, the yard looks like a winter wonderland. My sister and I made snow angels and built snowmen. We also made forts to play in. We used sticks and snowballs to fight. We were just kids and did not worry about anything.

You must understand one thing about Portland, Oregon. It is a city that likes to be different. The city's unofficial slogan is "Keep Portland Weird." This means the city wants to be a place where people can be themselves, even if that is different from others. Some people like this because it was like that long ago. They want to remember the old Portland, a city that was not well-known and was not expensive. This made it a place for creative and unique ideas. To others, it is a call to come and join them. Portland is still a weird place. It is not mean "weird" as in always accepting. It means accepting of things that others do not accept. Portland has modern things like other cities. We buy many things from China. But Portland also has a million ways to be different. In my neighborhood, there are colorful houses and gardens with flowers and vegetables. In the summer, there are boxes on the street with things people are giving away for free. These boxes can have anything - clothes, books, or other things. This is the magic of Portland. It is a city where you can find something special by chance. Portland is full of people who love many things. Some people go to yoga with goats, while others watch the city's soccer team play. Everyone in Portland likes something different. We have people who chase their dreams, or dream about chasing their dreams while spending time at the bar. Yes, Portland has problems with drugs. These problems are often connected to mental health. The rainy weather and gray skies may also be a part of the problem. Portland also has a problem with homelessness. Many people come here for help, but we do not have enough help for them. The people who are not homeless sometimes feel angry or sad about the situation. But this is not weird. It is a problem many cities face.

The mountains are always there. They are in the north. They see the sun every morning and every evening. I often forget about them when I am busy with work and life. But they are always there, steady and strong. On days when I am very stressed and sad, they help me feel better. I look at them and I feel a little stronger. I came to this town when I began my university studies. The mountains north of the campus were very beautiful. The university has many nice buildings and a pond. But the mountains are special. The rest of the town is also nice. There are many cafes where I studied and drank coffee. I can walk or take a bus to the downtown area. It is old and has a lot of character. The town is small but it has a lot of life. The town is near a big city. But it is easy to get away from the noise and be in a peaceful place. I have made many happy memories in this town. I walked with friends in the park and we saw the swings. We also went to the movies in a big theater. But this town also remembers sad times. I cried by the pond in the middle of the night. I thought about my life and my purpose. As I watched the animals by the pond, I wondered about my own life. I walked by the pond and the park and then I saw the main street. The sun was shining and it was beautiful. I looked up at the sun and I walked north. And there they were, the mountains. They were still there, strong and steady. They reminded me to keep going.

Bensonhurt in Brooklyn is easy to find. Public transportation is good and is used by many people. This neighborhood is part of New York City. It is an urban area, but you can still feel like you are in a big city. Many Asian stores are there. Over the past 20 years, many Asian people have moved to Bensonhurt. You will see Asian-owned stores on almost every block. These stores are popular for food, laundry, and more. The food is good, prices are low, and it is convenient. I live here, and there are four Asian supermarkets within a short walk. This makes buying groceries easy.

Not all people in Bensonhurt are Asian. Many immigrants and their children live here too. Most of the big stores are Asian-owned. There is also a park near me. It has many basketball courts, a big field for sports, handball courts, swings, and a water fountain for kids.

Bensonhurt has many two-family houses and co-op living buildings. People are generally nice, but it can be noisy. Cars drive by and play loud music. Some people also drive fast, which can wake you up. If you visit at night, be careful. This neighborhood is safe, but some people may cause trouble. I was bullied here a long time ago. Recently, people have stolen packages from each other. It's also a problem that people don't clean up after their dogs. You will see dog waste on the sidewalk every day. Keep your shoes clean when you walk here.

My neighborhood has no sidewalks. Everything goes downhill. My house is on the top of the biggest hill in the neighborhood. People call it the "workout hill" because many people run up it every day. Because there are no sidewalks on my street, everyone walks on the road. The road is not in good shape in some places, and it's not safe to drive on. The wires on my street are old and broken. The weather is rainy and stormy here, so the trees hit the wires often. The repairs make the wires look old and broken. There are many tall trees everywhere. But people do not like the trees. They try to cut down many of them. The trees block the view of the ocean. That's why many houses are built high up on the hill. They have big windows on the top floor to see the bay. It's nice to see the bay at sunset. The water shines and the sky turns orange. But it's often cloudy. Most days are gray and damp. Moss grows on everything. I left my car outside for a month, and it was covered in moss. It took three hours to clean it. There are not many children in my neighborhood. There is a school a few blocks away. Many people in my neighborhood are old and retired. They have dogs instead of children. You often see them in people's yards or running down the street. If you leave a door or window open, they can get into your house. I once found one in my living room. I had to chase it out. Rabbits are also a problem. They dig up plants and make holes in people's lawns. My cats like to hunt them. We also have birds like sparrows and hummingbirds. Sometimes a hawk or eagle comes, but the crows chase it away. There are no stores near my house. But if you walk down to the waterfront, there are some restaurants that serve fresh seafood. There is no beach, but you can throw rocks into the water. The bay is not very wide. You can see the other side even on cloudy days.

I live in a small town in Tennessee. My street is between two highways, so there is some traffic. But it is a quiet neighborhood. Most people on my street are friendly. They keep to themselves and do their own work. In the winter, I like to sled on a hill near my house. We have a big house at the front of our street, so we see everyone who passes by. We know most of the cars in the neighborhood. When we see a new car, we pay attention. Some neighbors walk for exercise or to take their dogs out. Children ride their bikes and play outside. My family and I work from home. There are four of us: my wife and our two daughters, ages 11 and 14. We are used to seeing each other come and go. We like to play outside, even in the rain. Sometimes we grill on our back deck. The smell of barbecue is nice. We have many trees in our neighborhood. The area was once a forest, so there is a lot of shade. But in the fall, there are many leaves, and we have to rake and burn them. The smell of burning leaves means fall is here. Lately, we have not had much winter. It feels like fall is long. Our garage is at the back of our house. We use the front door only when someone visits. I like to work in the garage and fix things. When the garage door is open, I feel connected to the neighborhood. Holidays are quiet here. On Thanksgiving, some families visit from out of town, and there are many extra cars. Other holidays, like Mother's Day and Christmas, are the same.

I like living here. If the street were not a through street, it would be perfect.

My home is in a desert area. It is very dry and brown. If you have never lived in a place like this, you may not understand what it is like. I have lived here since the 1990s. Many houses are spread out. But recently, new houses have been built. Now it looks like a city. Many places are changing like this. Most people are friendly. However, some are not. I like my neighborhood. There are old people who are nice. The stores are mostly big chains like Food 4 Less and Smart & Final. There are no stores like Whole Foods. If you want to buy healthy food, you have to go somewhere else. Many people work in construction. This city is not very developed yet. There is still much empty space. I do not like this. I left a big city and do not want to go back. My job is in construction. I install drywall and T-bars. I like the animals here. People come to the desert for its beauty. It is hard to live here because of the animals. We must learn about them to live safely. My children like lizards and desert bugs. They are outside trying to catch them now. Victorville is a good place for families. It is a good experience. If you visit, go to the San Bernardino County Fair. It is an annual event. You can also go to Wrightwood to see the snow-covered mountains and take winter sports lessons. If you like history and culture, visit the Victor Valley Museum. It has objects from the past that tell the story of Victorville's development.

When I describe my neighborhood, it is different from others. I live on a college campus. My community is the people in my dormitory. The campus is also my neighborhood. It is not like a usual neighborhood, but it has some similar things. It has houses, people, stores, and a park.

Let's start with the houses. My neighborhood has three types of houses. There are apartments, houses, and dormitories. The apartments usually have 2-4 people in each room. The dormitories are very common and have 100s of students. Each student shares a room with one other person.

In my neighborhood, there are people from many different cultures and ages. Many of the staff live in the houses. The newer students live in the dormitories, and the older students live in the apartments.

Now, let's talk about the stores and park. The campus is a self-contained neighborhood, so it has many stores. These stores sell food, clothes, and other things you need. The park is a place for everyone in the neighborhood to play. The park is clean and safe because everyone helps keep it that way.

I have lived in this neighborhood for about 10 years. When I first came here from Riverdale, I was sad. I missed my old home and friends. My mom and dad made us move because they wanted a better life for my sister and me. Here, we have a good house and a better school. Over time, I made new friends and enemies at school. I didn't know my neighbors very well, except Mr. Glen and his children. They are kind people and I consider them like family.

I remember Mr. Glen's wedding. It was fun. I caught a special strap that Ms. Veda wore. I also met one of their daughters, Marsharii. I haven't seen her in a long time. I hope she is happy.

The neighborhood is like a maze. I use a GPS to help me get around. I have explored some of it with my friends Kason and Curtis. We like to play video games and have fun. I also like to go to the park and be near nature. It makes me feel calm. I take sticks and practice my balance. I also have a wooden sword and like to play with it.

There is a basketball and tennis court. I used to play tennis with my dad and his friend, Mr. Graves. We worked hard, but it was fun. I hope to play again soon. I have many good memories in this neighborhood, and I think the best is yet to come.

I live in a neighborhood near my college. I enjoy living here because it is close to school. There are many apartment buildings, some restaurants and bars. I like going to these places because they are not very expensive. One bar changed its name, and it is a bit more expensive. However, it is not bad. Many people are friendly. They are mostly students or people who cannot afford to live in other places because the rent is low here.

There is a school near my apartment. This is why there are many children. I do not know my neighbors very well. They smoke a lot of marijuana. My landlord put a special machine in their apartment to remove bad smells. I think this is funny. My boyfriend and I found it strange.

The buildings around me are old, but they may have new inside. Some buildings across the street are brand new. But I do not like them. They are built poorly, and the rent is high. I think this is not fair. They are near the campus, so they can get away with it.

I like a small restaurant near my home. It is cheap, and they serve food quickly. There is a gas station near it, but people do not like working there. The city fixed the road near my home last year, so it is nicer now. My apartment building has trees around it. The city cut down some trees, but there are still many.

Behind my building is a line of trees and another apartment complex. I live on 42nd Street. The street behind mine is 43rd Street. It is not as nice. The sidewalks are broken, and the buildings look old. There are many trees here, but they hide the buildings. There is a lot of crime on 43rd Street. It is not just the one apartment complex, though. There are other apartments with problems too. I like where I live because it is affordable, and I have many things near me. The university is close, and there are two bus stops. I can easily go to the store or downtown.

My neighborhood is special. It has many houses on a circle. These houses look like separate homes. The only difference is they are all painted yellow with white porches and green metal roofs. Most people are friends with each other. We stand at the end of the road and talk in the evenings. Children play outside with toys and chalk. It is nice to be here in a world with many machines. It is like going backward in time.

We are near fields and trees. The sky is blue and white clouds are everywhere. But sometimes we have problems. This time of year, we have warnings about tornadoes. Recently, we heard sirens and had to seek shelter. I was in my bathtub with my little dog and a few pillows. My big dog stayed in the living room and barked. The neighborhood was quiet with only the sound of hail hitting the ground. After the storm, the road was hot and steaming. We had a big temperature change. The hail melted quickly on the hot pavement. Then the sun came out and it started to rain. I saw a double rainbow. I quickly took pictures with my camera. My friends on Facebook were amazed, just like me.

The neighborhood was quiet for a while after the storm. Then people started coming home. They were cooking dinner. It is a friendly neighborhood. I like it here. I moved from New Hampshire to North Carolina a while back. I like the way people talk down here. I have a two-bedroom apartment, like most people. But not all apartments are the same inside. Some are small. I like to walk in the big field behind my house. I go to the pond, but it is not safe to swim. I see deer and hear a big frog in the morning. It is a great place to live, near the city of Charlotte. Each morning, I hear roosters. It is like living in a small village. We have a donkey at a nearby farm who brays in the evening. I was lucky to find this neighborhood.

I moved to my new neighborhood when I was in eighth grade. It was hard to make friends at first, but I became close to two friends, one who lived two houses away and another on my street. Neither of them lives here anymore, but I still have happy memories. The people who lived here when I moved in are still here. My neighborhood is like many other American suburban neighborhoods. There are many two-story houses. On nice days, I hear kids playing outside. The neighborhood is usually quiet. I have never had a problem with anyone. If I need help, my neighbors will help me. I can trust them. They respect my personal space. I have ordered packages online many times and never lost them. I feel safe in my neighborhood.

There is a park near my house. I have many happy memories there. I played basketball, football, and baseball with my friends. But I also got hurt playing football and hit in the nose! Now, I go to the park to spend time with my younger cousin's kids. They love to play on swings and slides. The park makes me happy and sad at the same time. It reminds me of my childhood.

My neighborhood is good for many people. We have many kinds of food near us. You can find Chinese, Indian, Mexican, and Italian food within a mile. Many people order food from apps like GrubHub and DoorDash. We also have fast food places and pizza shops. There are many stores with everything we need. We have a dry cleaner, a pharmacy, and a big grocery store called Jewel-Osco. There is even an Indian store for people who want to make Indian food at home. I like my neighborhood. I am grateful to have good neighbors, unlike some people on social media and in the news.

My town is a small community. It is not different from other places in South Carolina. But it helps the country grow food. Johnston is called the Peach Capital of the World. This is what the town says on its welcome sign. The town is mostly farmland. Many people grow peaches or raise cattle. Houses are far apart. Most are two-story houses with metal or gray roofs. These roofs help keep the houses cool in the hot summer. The houses are not near the road. They are in the fields. In the main part of town, there is a four-way stop. This is where the town's stores are. There are a few places to get food quickly. They are called restaurants. There is Hong Kong, a Chinese restaurant. There is also Fiesta Mexican Restaurant and Gary's, a burger place. There used to be a pizza place, but it closed. There is a small pharmacy called Maxwell and Halford Drug. They sell a special kind of soda called Cherry Coca-Cola. There is a small grocery store called IGA. People do not buy most of their food there. They usually go to a bigger store in another town. The most popular store is Dollar General. It sells many things. Many people go there every day. There is a small furniture store called Possibilities Furniture & More. It is run by a kind woman. She has been there for a long time. There is a pet groomer next to the furniture store. They take care of dogs and cats. There is a doctor's office and a vet's office in the town. They are small, but they help the people of Johnston. There is one school called Johnston Elementary School. Children go there until they are in the fifth grade. Then they go to school in another town. The town does not have a park. But they are making a new place for people to play. It will be 2.5 acres big. People can walk their dogs and have fun there. The town is small. But it is a nice place to live.

I first learned about my place on a podcast about people who go missing. I was surprised. It's very expensive to live here. Almost every apartment costs over one thousand dollars a month. My friends and I had not heard of this story. It may be because we have a hard time making ends meet. Some of my friends cry themselves to sleep at night. Things are expensive, but we have learned to save money. We like second-hand things, like toys and clothes from a flea market. Adulthood is not as fresh as it used to be. We might start to smoke or just get used to things being a certain way. But the flea market is always there. It smells of dusty old magazines and old furniture.

There are three thrift stores near my home. I can walk to them. There are two charity thrift stores, a library, a store with old books, and a shop with strange objects. Downtown is busy. Many cars and people are there every morning. But it is quiet in the thrift stores. No matter how many people or cars pass by, the stores are silent. It's a nice place to spend the afternoon.

Every year, the city gets busier. Many cars and people come here. It's a growing city. One of the biggest companies for online shopping and delivery is here. The city still has some problems. It reminds me of New York. People are focused on their own goals, and they do not ask many questions. You can be alone, quiet, and independent. People will leave you alone if you want. It's not like the South, where people ask about your business. Here, you can be yourself, and the city will go on with its own pace, like the ocean. 

I like my apartment. There are people playing music next door and singing upstairs. It's always something happening. We have a community of friends instead of just strangers living in the same building. We help each other when we need it, celebrate birthdays, and mourn when someone dies. I feel lucky to live here. I like my neighbors, and they treat me well. We clean up after ourselves and help each other. It's nice to see them, and I think they enjoy my company too. I live in a big, modern city, but it's people like my neighbors who make me feel like I haven't made a big mistake in my life.

I live in a typical suburb. My neighborhood is part of a community with a homeowner's association. This group makes sure the homes are well-maintained. You will see many single-family houses with small yards. These yards have grass, pebbles, and short driveways. Some houses have two cars. The roads are in good condition. There are no potholes. Most houses are one story, but some are two stories. 

My house is at the edge of the city. This area is both rural and suburban. We have a lot of space for different activities. There are community pools that anyone can use. These pools are well-maintained and locked. We also have walking trails where you can walk your dog or go for a walk alone. You do not need to go to a park to be active. The neighborhood is large, so you can walk or run around it and get exercise.

Most people who live here are retired. The area is safe, and people help each other. Some middle-aged and young professionals also live here. The nearby city is big. It has a small-town feel. We have many things you need. For example, we have a mall. It is not very big, but it has what you need. It takes about 15 minutes to get to a place that is important. When you get there, you can find many stores. There are stores with good food and stores with cheap things.

My neighborhood is safe and well-maintained. We have nice things like pools and walking trails. We can easily go to a big store if we need something.

I live in a small town in the Midwest. It is near a big city in the suburbs. My neighborhood is on the east side of the town. It is one of the areas with low income. House prices are low here. Most people rent or buy these houses. However, it is not an unattractive place. My neighbors are friendly. They say hello when I walk by.

Crime rates are a little higher here than in other parts of the town. But they are still low. There have been some violent crimes in the last ten years. Some people have been hurt or killed in shootings. Our next-door neighbors lost their son in a shooting last year. But we have not been directly affected by crime. Sometimes things go missing from our porch if we leave them outside.

The town I live in has a big problem. Many people have died from taking too much of a strong medicine called fentanyl. There are many programs to help people who take too much medicine. These programs include places to help people stop using drugs and training for families and friends of people who have a problem with drugs.

Despite the problems, our town has many good things. My son's school is excellent. The principal, teachers, and other helpers are very good. He is happy there. The school has a positive atmosphere. No one is mean to him. We have a group of parents who help with the school. They plan many fun events. The school gives free breakfast and lunch to all students. No one has to go hungry. The town has fixed some roads and parks. But most of the improvements are in the center of the town where shops are. My neighborhood needs more improvements.

I like living in this town. People are friendly. The schools are good. There are many places to shop. We have a comfortable home. We have lived here for many years and do not want to move.

I live in a neighborhood with a lot of culture. My neighborhood is on a hill. It is surrounded by old buildings with important history. I live in a 7-story building across from a famous theater. A short walk away is a fun bar that is popular with people on summer nights. On weekends in June and July, people often wait in line to get in. We also have a big park nearby. The park is surrounded by concrete with tall stairs. During the cold winter months, homeless people set up tents along the sidewalk and stairs. This keeps them warm and close to a place where they can clean themselves.

I love my neighborhood because of the people. We used to have problems with gangs. The government and police tried to clean up the area many years ago. The people remember. They work hard to keep their community clean. They care about what happens in their neighborhood. Some people say it's not safe for white people to walk around at night. I think this is not true. I think it's because of old ideas and fears. I am a little mixed, which might be why the people here like me. They know I understand their problems. I feel safe walking around at night and meeting new people. They are kind and helpful. For example, they stayed open late so I could charge my phone when it was raining. They saw me sitting alone and cold, and they gave me money and said I was beautiful and important.

I live in a small town in Michigan. It is a place where you can see farmland and small cities. There is no big city with many stores like Wal-mart or Target. If you need to go somewhere, you usually have to drive. But I live in one of the most beautiful places in the world. My town is surrounded by water. There is a big lake on one side, Lake Michigan. On the other side is Lake Charlevoix. Everywhere you go, you can find a beach where you can put your feet in the water.

My neighborhood is a small town. The houses are not stacked on top of each other. They are old homes with basements. Some of the houses have been updated and fixed up. Others are older. Many houses have yards with trampolines and playsets for kids. Some people have gardens and fences for their animals. The houses look like the kind of homes you would see in the middle of the country. People here work hard to make a living. They are raising families or have already raised families. You can see kids playing outside on any day. You can also see people walking their dogs or riding their bikes.

Neighbors know each other. They can tell who belongs and who does not. If someone is grilling outside, you will see them wave. If someone is walking their dog from a few blocks away, you will see them smile and say hello. The lawns are kept neat and tidy. Nobody leaves their leaves on the ground in the fall. The grass is cut and well-manicured. If people have plants and bushes in their yards, they are trimmed and looked after.

My neighborhood is not fancy, but it is a good place to live. It is quiet and peaceful. It is safe. There are many things within walking distance. There is a police station and a jail. There is a place for recycling and a health department. We also have baseball and softball fields where you can hear the announcers calling the game. There is a small airport nearby where you can hear the sound of small planes taking off and landing. You can walk to get ice cream from the local ice cream shop. My kids can ride their bikes to the park, which is just a few blocks away. It is a great place to live.
